messages.message: Dave, how will this affect resource access via mobile? For instance, will we need zscaler to access zendesk, confluence, etc?

We’ll evaluate that as we go forward (we’ll be needing to work on our MDM story for mobile as well going forward) but we’ll be starting with key apps with confidential and sensitive data like AWS, GitHub etc

Zscaler does have a mobile client but as Instabase doesn’t own your device and we don’t know how much we want to get in the business of managing it, we’ll start to see a natural separation of what you can access from it and what you can’t in that sense. @Chris and I will be working on that as we go and definitely appreciate input.

Thanks Dave. I don’t want to speak on behalf of the whole of customer engineering, but at least Zendesk (which I understand won’t be high priority to loop into zscaler) should probably remain accessible for the sake of quick responses. The rest of our services that could contain client information, I would agree are not highly critical to have mobile access

Excellent call out, we have about 20-24 services that sit in various states and we have to think through, but the goal is to ensure safe comms not limit things so you can’t access things for work. Zendesk is one of those, but just because something is on that list doesn’t mean it requires Zscaler.
Also a lot of this depends on the MDM story for mobile devices, if we know they have a screen lock, remote wipe and a few other items, we can be more permissive with those for sure.
